main event: A horseshoe-shaped object, about one-third the diameter of the moon, was observed in the Pacific on 26 October 1962.
interesting points: The object was bright orange with a dark center and pulsating light,Observers saw a bright flash on the horizon before the object appeared,The object oscillated upward and downward,Another similar object appeared below the horizon and then faded out,The sighting lasted for approximately 1 1/3 seconds.
witness description: Co-pilot Colonel Holly Anderson and pilot Major A.E. Gasperson from a KC-135 aircraft.
